---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [889489bf34](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20225/commits/889489bf34c8570c853e549ab998fc8217378bfb)

#### Import changes for modified files

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`- coe_powerSeries`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (2.70, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|4610|-5|porting notes|
|1412|-2|erw|

Current commit [889489bf34](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/889489bf34c8570c853e549ab998fc8217378bfb)
Reference commit [e5ab45ea78](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/e5ab45ea78696d399f7632d6fbc9007a1c32579f)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/8329fe98-0a11-4277-ac0c-5bf307ad2d80) for commit 4fb1b8e8fcae23ecab698b6600f33b0261ef3dd3.
There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/62dbcc9b-47f4-42cc-b8b4-e5d957a00124/to/8329fe98-0a11-4277-ac0c-5bf307ad2d80) against commit e5ab45ea78696d399f7632d6fbc9007a1c32579f.

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|+11.451‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.00%)|
|`Mathlib.RingTheory.Support`|+1.144‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+6.26%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13099408861)
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/32b199b4-8cb9-4694-94e9-cb3cac9802c4) for commit 889489bf34c8570c853e549ab998fc8217378bfb.
There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/62dbcc9b-47f4-42cc-b8b4-e5d957a00124/to/32b199b4-8cb9-4694-94e9-cb3cac9802c4) against commit e5ab45ea78696d399f7632d6fbc9007a1c32579f.

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|-6.506‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.00%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13102446818)
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.
bors merge

Thanks for the clean-up; you even removed a few `erw`s! I have only minor comments, and will benchmark it to be safe. Assuming perf is alright:
maintainer delegate

Thanks for the clean-up; you even removed a few `erw`s! I have only minor comments, and will benchmark it to be safe. Assuming perf is alright:
maintainer delegate
Out of curiosity: why did the previous version work?
Any new variable introduced will shadow existing declaration/variable of the same name.
These changes are an improvement already. I wonder: should you make `m` and `n` arguments and move the two hypotheses left of the colon, while you're at it?
I don't think the proof by induction (by pattern matching) still work if you do that.
Thanks for teaching me this trick! My next PRs will use this from the beginning.

I'm slightly paranoid now: does this make a performance difference? (Can you e.g. check locally? If the simp is not very slow, e.g. does not show up with `set_option trace.profiler before the declaration, and reloading the file, this should be fine.)
Pre-existing: can you use named arguments for `M`, `S` and `ih`?
In an induction pattern? No
Can you use `obtain`, or do you really need a `let`?
Why `obtain` when `let` is shorter?
I have no preference either way.
`let` is fine here.

Not sure this is an improvement. I'll probably do
```
  rw [show proj i = comp (proj i) id' from rfl]; apply h; apply hasStrictFDerivAt_id
```
I think that's less readable than either the existing code or the code I propose
I agree that `rw [show ...]` is not usually preferable to `have... ; rw`
The `simp only` can't be combined with `rw`?
No, it's rewriting under the integral.
Also not sure this is an improvement

Probably the slowdown is due to this `simp`. The slowdown in Haar.Unique is probably also due to the `simp` but more reasonable. (Files beyond the first two in the table below are not touched by this PR.)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ce32a033-2f0c-414b-8de4-270ffdeaca8f)

What's going on here? I think the original means
```
from `X : R‚∏®X‚∏©` to `single 1 1 : HahnSeries ‚Ñ§ R`.
```
Hm, not sure how I ended up with this, but it's much clearer writing out the `R` rather than using `_`. Fixed

pullRequest.title: chore: tidy various files
